title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: 4. (1) In this Order, unless the context otherwise requires—
text_raw:
4. (1) In this Order, unless the context otherwise requires— 

“Act” means the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999), as 
amended; 

“generator” means a person licensed to generate electricity under Section 
14(1)(a) of the Act; 

“generator site” means the site owned (or occupied pursuant to a lease, licence 
or other agreement) by the generator which contains the connection point; 

“installed capacity” means the normal full load kW capacity of any apparatus 
which produces electricity, as stated on their nameplates; and 

“S.I. No. 60 of 2005” means the European Communities (Internal Market in 
Electricity) Regulations 2005 (S. I. No. 60 of 2005). 

(2) In this Order: 

(a) 

(b) 

a reference to an article or schedule is to an Article of, or 
Schedule to, this Order, unless it is indicated that reference to 
some other provision is intended. 

a reference to a paragraph is a reference to a paragraph of the 
provision in which the reference occurs, unless it is indicated 
that reference to some other provision is intended. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th September, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [459] 3 

(c) A word or expression that is used in this Order and is also used 
in the Act has, unless the contrary intention appears, the same 
meaning in this Order as it has in the Act. 

(d) Where a word or expression is given a meaning in the Act or in 
this Order then, except where the context otherwise requires, 
any cognate word or expression used in this Order shall be 
construed accordingly. 

Purpose.
text_norm: 4 (1) order unless context otherwise requires-- act mean electricity regulation act 1999 (no 23 1999) amended generator mean person licensed generate electricity section 14(1)(a) act generator site mean site owned (or occupied pursuant lease licence agreement) generator contains connection point installed capacity mean normal full load kw capacity apparatus produce electricity stated nameplate s.i no 60 2005 mean european community (internal market electricity) regulation 2005 (s i no 60 2005) (2) order (a) (b) reference article schedule article schedule order unless indicated reference provision intended reference paragraph reference paragraph provision reference occurs unless indicated reference provision intended notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 16th september 2022 459 3 (c) word expression used order also used act unless contrary intention appears meaning order act (d) word expression given meaning act order except context otherwise requires cognate word expression used order shall construed accordingly purpose

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: 5. (1) Pursuant to Section 16(3A) of the Act, the Commission may by
text_raw:
5. (1) Pursuant to Section 16(3A) of the Act, the Commission may by 
order provide for the authorisation of persons in relation to the construction or 
reconstruction of a class or classes of generating station. 

(2) Generating stations approved by the Commission as being located 

within a current or prospective generator site with either: 

(a) 

(b) 

a related installed capacity of greater than 1 MW and not 
exceeding 10 MW, or 

a related installed capacity not exceeding 1 MW, are classes of 
generating station to which this Order applies. 

Authorisation.
text_norm: 5 (1) pursuant section 16(3a) act commission may order provide authorisation person relation construction reconstruction class class generating station (2) generating station approved commission located within current prospective generator site either (a) (b) related installed capacity greater 1 mw exceeding 10 mw related installed capacity exceeding 1 mw class generating station order applies authorisation

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: 6. (1) (a) A person proposing to construct or re-construct a class of
text_raw:
6. (1) (a) A person proposing to construct or re-construct a class of 
generating station referred to in Article 5(2)(a) shall provide a 
notification of this proposal to the Commission in the manner 
prescribed in the terms and conditions as set out in Schedule 2 to 
this Order. 

(b) A person proposing to construct or re-construct a class of 
in Article 5(2)(b) shall 

generating station 
automatically stand duly authorised pursuant to this Order. 

referred 

to 

(2) Upon the Commission’s issuing of confirmation that it has received a 
person’s valid notification in accordance with Article 6(1)(a), that person shall 
stand duly authorised pursuant to this Order.” 

Amendment or Revocation of Order.

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: 8. A person duly authorised to construct or reconstruct a generating station
text_raw:
8. A person duly authorised to construct or reconstruct a generating station 
pursuant to this Order shall be required to comply with the terms and 
conditions stated in Schedule 1 to this Order. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [459]

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: An authorised person shall furnish to the Commission information in
text_raw:
6. 
An authorised person shall furnish to the Commission information in 
such manner and at such times as the Commission may require, and shall 
procure and furnish to it such reports as the Commission may consider 
necessary in the light of the conditions or as it may require for the purpose of 
performing the functions assigned or transferred to it by or under the Act. The 
power of the Commission to request information under this paragraph is 
without prejudice to the power of the Commission to request information under 
or pursuant to the Act or this Order. 

In this paragraph, “information” shall include any permissions, consents, 
licences, (including any conditions attached to such permissions, consents or 
investigations, documents, records (whether stored, 
licences), surveys, 
maintained or preserved by means of any mechanical or electronic device or 
otherwise), accounts, estimates, or reports (whether or not prepared specifically 
at the request of the Commission) of any description specified by the 
Commission. 

A person duly authorised to construct or reconstruct a generating station
text_norm: 6 authorised person shall furnish commission information manner time commission may require shall procure furnish report commission may consider necessary light condition may require purpose performing function assigned transferred act power commission request information paragraph without prejudice power commission request information pursuant act order paragraph information shall include permission consent licence (including condition attached permission consent investigation document record (whether stored licences) survey maintained preserved mean mechanical electronic device otherwise) account estimate report (whether prepared specifically request commission) description specified commission person duly authorised construct reconstruct generating station

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: pursuant to Article 6(2) of this Order shall not, without the prior written
text_raw:
7. 
pursuant to Article 6(2) of this Order shall not, without the prior written 
consent of the Commission, assign or transfer an authorisation. Any consent of 
the Commission to any assignment or transfer of an authorisation under Article 
6(2) shall be subject to the Commission being satisfied that the assignee will 
have the technical and financial capability to comply with: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [459] 5 

(a) 

the conditions of this Order, and 

any other matters determined by the Commission to be 

(b) 
necessary.

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: The Commission may at any time revoke an authorisation issued to an
text_raw:
8. 
The Commission may at any time revoke an authorisation issued to an 
authorised person by giving not less than 30 days’ notice in writing if in the 
opinion of the Commission, one or more of the following circumstances exist: 

if the person agrees in writing with the Commission that the 

(a) 
authorisation should be revoked; 

if the person fails to comply with a direction under section 23 or 
(b) 
section 24 of the Act, a determination under section 25 of the Act or an 
order under section 26 of the Act which (in respect of any of these 
cases) has been made in respect of a contravention or likely 
contravention of any of the conditions of this Order and (in respect of 
any of these cases) such failure is not rectified to the satisfaction of the 
Commission within three months (or such other period as the 
Commission may specify) after the Commission has given notice of 
such failure to the person. Provided that in respect of a direction under 
section 24 of the Act, no such notice shall be given by the Commission 
before the expiration of the period within which representations or 
objections under section 24 of the Act could be made questioning a 
direction under section 24 of the Act or before the proceedings relating 
to any such representations or objections are finally determined; 

(c) 

if the authorised person: 

(i) 
is unable to pay its debts (within the meaning of section 
214 of the Companies Act 1963) or if it enters into any scheme 
of arrangement (other than for the purpose of reconstruction or 
amalgamation upon terms and within such period as may 
previously have been approved in writing by the Commission); 
or 

(ii) 
has a receiver or an examiner within the meaning of the 
Companies (Amendment) Act 1990, of the whole or any 
material part of its assets or undertaking appointed; or 

(iii) 
passes any resolution for winding up other than a 
resolution previously approved in writing by the Commission; 
or 

becomes subject to an order for winding up by a court of 

(iv) 
competent jurisdiction. 

(d) 
For the purposes of paragraph (c)(i) of this condition, section 
214 of the Companies Act, 1963 shall have effect as if for “€1,000” 
there was substituted “€50,000” or such higher figure as the 
Commission may from time to time determine by notice in writing to 
the authorised person. 

 
 
 
 6 [459]

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: A valid notification under Article 6(1) shall take the form of a signed
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 2 

A valid notification under Article 6(1) shall take the form of a signed 
declaration that the authorised person shall abide by the terms and conditions 
listed in Schedule 1 and include, among other things, details relating to the 
name of the generation station, the address of the generating station, owner of 
the generating station, the generation station type, and the installed capacity of 
the generating station. 

Sealed with the common seal of the Commission for 
Regulation of Utilities on 7 September, 2022. 

AOIFE MACEVILLY, 

Chairperson of the Commission. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [459] 7

title: Regulation 13(b) of the European Communities (Internal Market in Electricity)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of this Order is to provide for the authorisation of persons to 
construct or reconstruct generating stations located within a Generator Site 
with an installed capacity not exceeding 10 MW by way of Order made 
pursuant to Section 16(3A) of the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [459]
